alert.note: Alert for Loess Plains (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 30 at 2:41AM CDT until April 30 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS EXPECTED SUNDAY AFTERNOON INTO EARLY EVENING FOR FIRE ZONE 219... ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 8 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY VALUES AND STRONG WINDS FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONE 219... * AFFECTED AREA...Fire Weather Zone 219 Loess Plains. * TIMING...1 PM CDT through 8 PM CDT Sunday. * WINDS...North 10 to 20 mph with gusts up to 30 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 14 percent. * TEMPERATURES...In the middle 60s. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly and be very difficult to control. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
